title: Guest Wireless | Academic Computing and Communications Center | University of Illinois at Chicago
contents:

Academic Computing and Communications Center     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Academic Computing and Communications Center      Academic Computing and Communications Center   Main Menu    Services           Communication and Collaboration    Computing Services    Infrastructure    Professional Services    Research    Security    Teaching and Learning         Support           Academic Continuity    Academic Multimedia Lab and Lightboard Studio    ARC Helpdesk    C-Stop BSB    C-Stop LHS    Daley Library Helpdesk    LTS Support Office         Service Status           Service Notices         News           All News         Forms    About           Identity    Leadership    Policies    Reports    Jobs          Eyebrow menu    WebStore    Online Training    Answers    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Academic Computing and Communications Center    Services    Infrastructure    Network    Guest Wireless        Guest Wireless  Access to UIC's guest wireless network (UIC-Guest) is a privilege and all guests are required to abide by the UIC Guest Wireless Policy. There are three methods for guests to obtain wireless network access while on the UIC Campus: self-created guest access, staff-sponsored guest access and eduroam.       Quick Access               Request Guest Wireless Login            Sponsor Guest Access             Contact Us          hide   AVAILABLE TO: Faculty | Students | Staff  FUNDED BY :  University       Answers  Features  More Info         Common Questions   Common Questions   How can guest and visitors access UIC Wireless?  What is the UIC Guest Wireless Policy?  How do I use eduroam?  Where do find Guest Login Access Request?  More…            Features   Self-created Guest Access   Visitors to the UIC campus can self-create guest account credentials using the UIC-Guest Self Service Wireless Account Creation page (This page can only be accessed from on the UIC campus)  To use this service you must be able to receive SMS text messages (standard text message rates apply) on your cell phone  This service will not work with Google Voice  Guests are allowed to create up to five accounts per semester  Guest accounts created using this service expire in 48 hours after they are created   Staff-sponsored Guest Access   UIC faculty and staff may create guest wireless accounts for guests to the university that are active for up to two weeks using the Temporary Guest Wireless page  These accounts may be pre-created and activated on a specified date which is ideal for scheduled visitors. Guest accounts created using this service are valid for up to two weeks   Eduroam   UIC is a member of eduroam  Visitors to the UIC campus from other eduroam institutions may connect to the eduroam SSID using their credentials from their home institution  UIC does not provide support for visitors to configure their devices for eduroam use as the configuration is determined by the home institution            More Info   Applicability  Everyone using the UIC wireless networks must abide by the ACCC Acceptable Use Policy . There are additional bandwidth and file-sharing limitations on the networks, described in the Acceptable Use Policy for Res-Net and the UIC Public Wireless Networks .  Requirements   Your valid UIC NetID and password for user authentication  The wireless network’s certificate, which ensures that your device is actually connecting to UIC-WiFi  You should download and then install the certificate over a non UIC-Wifi connection prior to connecting:  Download Certificate for Microsoft computers and devices  Download Certificate for all other computers and devices     The certificate should show as Issued to: InCommon RSA Server CA – if it doesn’t then download and install the other certificate listed above. When installing you must trust these certificates when prompted  To be close enough to an UIC-WiFi ACCC public wireless access point.   Cost  The UIC-WiFi public network may be used by members of the UIC community at no charge. Students who reside in UIC residence halls must pay the Res-Net charge; this part of the UIC-WiFi network is not public. Visitors to UIC may be eligible to use either UIC-Guest or eduroam.              Google Maps image     C-Stop, BSB   1007 West Harrison Street,  Behavioral Sciences Building(BSB), Learning Center, First Floor,  Chicago,  IL    Phone: (312) 413-0003  Website: https://accc.uic.edu/support         Service Level Agreement       Service Request Fulfillment Time  Guest connections are activated within 24 hours after completion of the request form is submitted. 
Staff sponsored guest credentials are activated within 10 minutes of request form completion.
